english: door; gate; entrance; classifier for subjects/branches

etymology.description: pictogram: a gate; compare 戶 “(one) door”, half of the character.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a pair of swinging doors within a frame, representing a gate or entrance. Traditional 門 shows two door leaves; simplified 门 keeps the frame and a central stroke, preserving the concept of an opening.
etymology.simplification: Reduced stroke count by collapsing the inner leaves to a single vertical line and straightening the frame; standardized as the common radical form in simplified characters.

examples.chinese: 请把门关上(請把門關上)。
他选了三门课程(他選了三門課程)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuǎn le sān mén kèchéng.

examples.chinese: 我在门口等你(我在門口等你)。
examples.english: I'll wait for you at the entrance.
